page.title: 02Local History of Rawdon
page.content: The first Domesday survey shows that {Rawdon}was owned by several Saxon thanes.It was given by William to one of his archers, Paul,for services rendered in battle.Paul de Rawdon's family was connected with the village for 600 years.The family house E of the church still exists.It became the property of another local family the Laytons.Francis L.1577-1661,was one of the masters of the Jewel House of Charles I and II.In 1645 he compounded for his estate Â£3670 to the Parliamentarians.Two yeats later he started the building of St. Peters church.His son Thomas built the old school in 1710.South of the village is Crag Wood where several wealthy industrialists built their homes.On the slopes of the Billing were three old coal pits.Many quarries round about provided sandstone for building.
